page.title: 14LOCAL SERVICES
page.content: Local services are limited: one shop-cum-post office and one pub. Travelling grocery and butchers vans are helpful, but most people drive into Appleby for supplies.Well stocked cupboards and freezers are a necessary feature of most homes here. Doctor and dentist are in Appleby and the nearest general hospital is 35 miles away, at Carlisle. The Health Visitor plays a vital role in rural areas. The lack of a bus service makes personal transport essential, but there is much co-operation and sharing of cars. The telephone is a vital link here.
